author: Jun Wang and Bin Yu and Les Gasser
title: Concept Tree Based Clustering Visualization with Shaded Similarity Matrices
window: we will briefly show how shaded similarity matrices are constructed and how one looks through an example. The data used in the example is part of the Iris data from the UCI repository[9]. The Iris data set contains 150 instances, evenly distributed in 3 classes. We fetch 5 instances from each class, and thus obtain 15 instances (Table 1). The similarity matrix was computed based on Euclidean distance
